content.title: Polyarteritis Nodosa (PAN)
content.definition: Necrotizing vasculitis of medium-sized muscular arteries without glomerulonephritis or vasculitis in arterioles, capillaries, or venules, and not associated with ANCA antibodies. It causes segmental, transmural inflammation leading to aneurysm formation and organ infarction.

pathophysiology.vessel_involvement: Medium-sized muscular arteries at branch points
pathophysiology.histology: Fibrinoid necrosis of vessel wall, all stages coexist

gastrointestinal.presentation: Abdominal pain, GI bleeding, bowel infarction

criteria: Biopsy with PMN in artery wall

clinical_pearls: PAN is ANCA-negative and spares glomeruli - this distinguishes it from microscopic polyangiitis
Mononeuritis multiplex with hypertension and abdominal pain should raise suspicion for PAN
String of beads on mesenteric/renal angiography is highly suggestive
Always check hepatitis B status - HBV-associated PAN requires antiviral therapy
common_misconceptions: Misconception: PAN and microscopic polyangiitis are the same - Reality: MPA has ANCA, involves small vessels, and causes glomerulonephritis
